image.altText: Anthony Albanese walking on a red dirt road surrounded by people in body paint carrying red flags

items.synopsis: The prime minister has made clear that fear of the Voice referendum failing will not stop him from keeping his word to the late Yolngu leader and land rights legend Yunupiŋu, writes Patricia Karvelas.

title.children: Anthony Albanese stares down calls for rethink on timing of the Voice referendum

image.altText: Players competing for the ball

items.synopsis: The FIFA Women's World Cup round of 16 gets underway with sixth-ranked Spain taking on Switzerland in Auckland. Later, Japan takes on Norway in Wellington. Follow live.

title.children: Japan lead Norway after scintillating Spain smash Swiss at Women's World Cup

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Upon arrival at Sydney Airport, Sam Kerr has told Channel 9 she will play against Denmark on Monday night. Just thought you might like to know that.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Sam Kerr says she's playing on Monday

children.content: Upon arrival at Sydney Airport, Sam Kerr has told Channel 9 she will play against Denmark on Monday night.
Just thought you might like to know that.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Miyazawa cooly slots home! That should be that. With Norway streaming forward they were ripe for the picking. It was Fujino with the perfectly weighted through ball for Miyazawa, who has her fifth goal of the tournament.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: GOAAAAAAAAL JAPAN!

children.content: Miyazawa cooly slots home! That should be that.
With Norway streaming forward they were ripe for the picking. It was Fujino with the perfectly weighted through ball for Miyazawa, who has her fifth goal of the tournament.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: There's the critical breakthrough! Japan worked it well into the box and then a poor ball out from Boa Risa went staight to Risa Shimizu, who's shot comes off a defensive leg and settles in the back of the net. As a neutral you love to see it, this match was threatening to turn into a bit of a game of chess. Now Norway have to chase the game, and that will give Japan even more opportunities to find space.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: 48' GOAAAAAL JAPAN!

children.content: Japan worked it well into the box and then a poor ball out from Boa Risa went staight to Risa Shimizu, who's shot comes off a defensive leg and settles in the back of the net.
As a neutral you love to see it, this match was threatening to turn into a bit of a game of chess. Now Norway have to chase the game, and that will give Japan even more opportunities to find space.

image.altText: Donald Trump, holding an umbrella in the rain, speaks to reporters at an airport.

items.synopsis: US prosecutors flagged a threatening social media post from Donald Trump in a late-night court filing, arguing that it suggests he might intimidate witnesses by improperly disclosing confidential evidence received from the government.

title.children: 'IF YOU GO AFTER ME, I'M COMING AFTER YOU!': Trump's social media post flagged by US prosecutors to judge

image.altText: A close up of Imran Khan in a black suit as he talks and gestures with his hand.

items.synopsis: Legal experts say the conviction could end Khan's chances of participating in national elections that have to be held before early November.

title.children: Former Pakistan prime minister Imran Khan sentenced to three years in prison

image.altText: Woman drinking wine from a glass, in profile

items.synopsis: Even drinking in moderation — one or two drinks each day over the week — is risky. Here are some tips for incorporating alcohol-free days into your routine.

title.children: A glass of wine each night or many over a big weekend — is one healthier than the other?

image.altText: Close up of Queensland Police Service-issued black gun in holster on navy pants

items.synopsis: The incident occurred while police were executing a search warrant in the afternoon.

title.children: Queensland police shoot man dead at Burpengary East

image.altText: An oil tanker is moored.

items.synopsis: A Russian tanker is damaged in a Ukrainian drone attack in the Kerch Strait, briefly halting traffic on the strategic bridge linking Crimea to Russia, Russian maritime officials say.

title.children: Russia says tanker hit by sea drone in Ukrainian attack near Crimea bridge

image.altText: Vladimir Putin in a black shirt and jacket

items.synopsis: Russia's president may have placed himself at the pinnacle of a so-called "power vertical", but some believe one "humiliating" weekend could be the beginning of the end for his regime.

title.children: 'Absolute dismay and confusion': A picture is emerging of Putin in crisis. It could threaten his rule

image.altText: aerial view of dead mangroves

items.synopsis: Environmental advocates have developed a detailed strategy to restore a polluted mangrove forest in Adelaide's north, and prevent future damage.

title.children: Strategic plan paves pathway to recovery for threatened St Kilda mangroves

image.altText: A woman surfs in the curl of a large wave.

items.synopsis: Teenager Lilliana Bowrey is used to life in the water, but a chance audition has taken her to the small screen.

title.children: 'Mindblowing rapid change': How an 18-year-old surfer ended up nominated for a Logie

image.altText: auction sign out from of two storey home

items.synopsis: The Reserve Bank's mission to bring inflation down to its target range of between 2 and 3 per cent appears to be on track, but how confident of this can we be? Movements in the Australian dollar give us some clues, writes David Taylor.

title.children: What the fall in the Australian dollar tells us about the future of interest rate rises

image.altText: A young woman smiles in front of a pop-up gazebo tent

items.synopsis: It's a busy Saturday night and a group has set up a pop-up gazebo tent, chairs and a first aid kit. Their mission is to help people enjoying a night out get home safely.

title.children: When Kristen turned 18, she could have hit Sydney's nightlife. But she's decided to keep others safe

image.altText: A man in a grey jumper sits on a bed in a room with a tv, and paintings on the wall.

items.synopsis: There's a common cycle for many children in this town: Crime, watch house, detention. Background Briefing investigates why.

title.children: Marty woke to find three intruders in his bedroom. His story is one of hundreds from his hometown

image.altText: A Wallabies player reacts after the loss to the All Blacks in the Bledisloe Cup.

items.synopsis: While their fans may be encouraged by the performance against the All Blacks, the Wallabies are left to rue a missed opportunity after blowing a sizeable lead in the second Bledisloe Cup Test in Dunedin.

title.children: Five quick hits – Wallabies reminded Test rugby is an 80-minute game as All Blacks reign supreme

image.altText: Anthonty Albanese wearing a pink shirt and a wide brimmed hat surrounded by red flags and people in body paint.

items.synopsis: In a speech at the Garma Festival, Prime Minister Anthony Albanese promises to hold the Indigenous Voice to Parliament referendum this year, rejecting calls to delay or cancel it.

title.children: 'We will not deny the urgency of this moment': Albanese promises to hold Voice referendum in 2023

image.altText: Indigenous teenagers enjoy friendship and culture at the youth forum

items.synopsis: Twelve months after committing to a Voice referendum during last year's Garma Festival, Prime Minister Anthony Albanese is drumming up support for the Yes campaign at this year's event. Catch up on all the action from this year's event.

title.children: Anthony Albanese says referendum will happen this year as he urges 'vote Yes for better future’

image.altText: Aerial photo shows rescue workers deploy life rafts for evacuating residents during floods.

items.synopsis: Struggling with the city's heaviest rainfall in at least 140 years, Beijing officials make the decision to divert floodwaters elsewhere, causing devastation in cities like Zhuozhou, which one official described as "a moat for the capital".

title.children: Beijing floodwaters diverted as anger sparked over plans to use outer cities as 'moat for the capital'

image.altText: People protecting their faces from smoke.

items.synopsis: Thousands scrambled to catch a glimpse of 2022's "Streamer of the Year" Kai Cenat and the chance to get free gaming products at his giveaway event in New York City.

title.children: Scenes of chaos at live streamer giveaway event, as arrests and injuries ensued

image.altText: A man in camouflage is escorted out the back of a police vehicle by two uniformed officers

items.synopsis: For almost 25 years the mystery of a teenager's murder left a close-knit community wondering if a killer walked among them. Now, new details of how undercover police caught her murderer have been revealed.

title.children: How undercover police posed as a crime gang to extract confession from killer of teenager Michelle Bright

image.altText: A police crime scene.

items.synopsis: A man has died after he was shot multiple times while walking along a street in South Yarra, in Melbourne's inner south-east. Police say the man appears to have been targeted and had links to organised crime.

title.children: Police confirm Melbourne shooting victim had links to organised crime

image.altText: A girl waves a fan in her face.

items.synopsis: The Australian contingent is reviewing its options after hundreds of young people succumbed to blistering conditions at the World Scout Jamboree, but leaders say our youngsters have been taking the conditions in their stride.

title.children: Aussie scouts handle South Korean heatwave 'like champs' as US and Brits abandon camp

image.altText: Jeremy Cameron kicks a goal from outside 50 for Geelong

items.synopsis: Geelong host Port Adelaide while the Giants and Swans meet in a Sydney derby, after Hawthorn stunned Collingwood for one of the upsets of the year. Follow our live AFL ScoreCentre for all the scores, stats and results.

title.children: AFL live: Hawks stun Pies, top eight to be shaped as Cats host Port and Giants battle Swans

image.altText: Latrell Mitchell looks upwards during a game

items.synopsis: Brisbane thump the Cowboys in Townsville and the Knights pip the Dolphins by two points, before South Sydney meets Cronulla. Follow our ScoreCentre for all the live scores and stats.

title.children: NRL live: Rabbitohs take on Sharks after Knights edge Dolphins to open Perth double-header

image.altText: A crab with its pincers out and a man and woman

items.synopsis: A crab-tying champion and a couple on their perpetual honeymoon try to explain why this out-of-the-way Queensland hamlet is paradise.

title.children: Meet Jason, the 'pirate' of Stanage Bay, a fishing town so idyllic some visitors never leave

image.altText: Two pictures of a cave. One with coverng of spinifex and sme trees, the other of the same cave but with no vegetation

items.synopsis: The government is refusing to say publicly if it's scrapping its controversial Aboriginal Heritage Act laws, although the ABC understands they will be repealed just over a month since they were implemented.

title.children: WA government refuses to confirm imminent backflip on controversial Juukan Gorge laws

image.altText: A bowl of steaming rice.

items.synopsis: The Indian rice export ban, the war in Ukraine and El Niño are combining to create a "doom loop" for the world's poorest people, as staple food prices soar.

title.children: The price of rice is skyrocketing, and it's pushing millions more people towards starvation

image.altText: Mark, a fair-skinned man, wearing a black cap and jacket gazes handful of freshly picked olives in dappled sunlight of a grove.

items.synopsis: Chef Mark Best says Australian table olives offer better quality for consumers, truth in labelling and help reduce the impact of food miles on the environment.

title.children: Leading chef calls on Aussies to buy locally grown olives as a 'fresher and better' option

image.altText: Black and white photo of men near satellite

items.synopsis: Voyager 2 was exploring interstellar space 19 billion kilometres away from Earth when an erroneous command caused it to tilt its antenna way from earth.

title.children: NASA restores contact with missing Voyager 2 spacecraft after weeks of silence

image.altText: A close up photo of a woman in elasticated waist pants holding her hands on her stomach

items.synopsis: Over time, sucking in your stomach can lead to hourglass syndrome, a condition that can cause changes in the appearance of the stomach — and may also affect other parts of the body, writes Adam Taylor.

title.children: Be wary of sucking your stomach in all the time — you could end up with hourglass syndrome

image.altText: A composite image showing two physicists and the Nagasaki mushroom cloud.

items.synopsis: The story of the first nuclear weapons is, in some respects, the story of a human chain reaction behind an atomic one. With scientists sharing information about the feasibility of a bomb, a crucial moment occurred in 1941, when Australian scientist Mark Oliphant met with American physicists in California.

title.children: An Australian helped shift Oppenheimer 'from the shadows of theory' to the Manhattan Project
